roleset.name: handle, deal with, transaction
roleset.note: DEAL-V NOTES: Probably two distinct senses, but syntactically similar enough to be merged. (from deal.01-v)

DEAL-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on OntoNotes (n) deal.01 and PB deal.01. This nominalization is not a member of PB deal.01's Vncls, as that relates to a different sense that was grouped with this sense in PB, and does not have 'deal-n' as a nominalized counterpart. This frame differs from PB deal.01 in its inclusion of an additional arg, arg2, subject of transaction, which may appear frequently, and arg3, value of transaction, which appears occasionally. (from deal.01-n)
DEALING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, deal-n.01, deal-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls cope-83. (from dealing.01-n)

roles.note: This nominalization takes syntax that is somewhere between the deal-v.01(handling) and deal-n.01(transacting) rolesets. I'm breaking up dealing.01 and .02 based on syntactic behavior rather than the semantic distinctions shown in deal-v and deal-n, which looks like it's going to put 'drug dealing' into dealing.02. So, fair warning. (from dealing.01-n)

example.name: deal-v: deal with
example.text: By contrast, Value Line said Georgia-Pacific-1 ``is in a comparatively good position *trace*-1 to deal with weakening paper markets,'' ...

example.name: deal-v: deal in
example.text: The idea was to let small investors, the backbone of the fund business, deal in the money market's high short-term interest rates.
example.arg: small investors, the backbone of the fund business,
in the money market's high short-term interest rates

example.name: deal-n: args 1 and 2 (with 2 as proposition)
example.text: a series of deals with Russia to acquire an aircraft carrier , fighter jets and tanks
example.arg: to acquire an aircraft carrier , fighter jets and tanks

example.name: deal-n: arg0, agreement
example.text: when he signed for his deal...

example.name: deal-n: all dealers as arg1, and TMP
example.text: the final deal between us and the Palestinians

example.name: deal-n: args 0, 2 and 3
example.text: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts 's megabillion RJR Nabisco deal

example.name: dealing-n: both args with co-dealer
example.text: What is you stance on his dealing with China about Sikkim and Tibet ??!!!

example.name: dealing-n: both args: dealing in
example.text: the prohibition against their dealing in new articles of clothing;

roleset.name: play cards, distribute something, distribution
roleset.note: DEAL-V NOTES: VN updated by Julia. Member of Vncls give-13.1. (from deal.02-v)
DEAL-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. Member of Vncls give-13.1. (from deal.02-n)
DEALING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, deal-n.02, deal-v.02. Corresponds to VNcls give-13.1 (from dealing.02-n)

example.name: deal-v: metaphorical
example.text: But the computer-guided selling in response to those developments dealt a serious blow to the over-the-counter market, Mr. DaPuzzo said.
example.arg: the computer-guided selling in response to those developments

example.name: deal-n: args 1 and 2
example.text: the deal of the cards to the players

example.name: deal-n: with PRD
example.text: the first deal of the cards into three piles

example.name: dealing-n: drug dealing
example.text: Once drug dealing -LRB- AKA beer , wine , and liquor sales -RRB- became legal and regulated , murders in America dropped dramatically .
example.arg: -LRB- AKA beer, wine, and liquor sales -RRB-

example.name: dealing-n: args 0 and 1
example.text: While it starts off with Duke discussing how to narrow your decisions in a hand (complete with her dealing the cards to give examples), it eventually comes off as a little scattered.

example.name: dealing-n: All args- metaphorical distribution
example.text: I was wondering if you would care to expound on the bit about Napoleon and his dealing a blow to the catholic church ?!

example.name: dealing-n: all args
example.text: Radomski is describing his use of steroids and his dealing drugs to athletes.

roleset.name: situation, occurance, event
roleset.note: DEAL-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-6. (from deal.03-n)

example.name: deal-n: no biggie.
example.text: In a situation where America did n't dare to stand forward , the Philippines ' jumping up and down would be useless , no big deal
